content.description:
Thin crack beside a large flake to a ledge, up a steep finish to anchor.



From the Morning Glory area, partway down on Ahren's Rock, thin crack to the right of a big flake. Belay from platform by a switchback.

Bolted anchor

This route is a good challenge on the first flake and then levels off above. The bolts are quite spread out, so having a bit of gear along can add to the comfort level when leading. Can be accessed from the top, so technically could be top-roped as well.

The bolts are evident on the rock. The route starts right above a wooden signed labelled Ahren's Rock
Bolts, anchor on the top

The approach takes approximately twenty minutes from the Mud Creek parking lot. You start your approach by walking the trail through two large square boulders. From there you continue to a gravel stream bed, don't follow that, the trail is straight up and is immediately apparent when you find it, as it is well constructed and well maintained. You will come to a fork in the trail and take the left option. The approach trails in this area are amazing. You will pass by the base of Small Walls and then arrive at the base of Ahren's Rock (marked by a sign). The first sport route (5.6) is to the right of a little wooden stair.
